One of the best ways to prepare red meat in a healthier way is to use cooking methods that minimize the formation of potentially harmful compounds. For example, instead of charring or broiling meat at very high temperatures, which can create heterocyclic amines (HCAs), consider using gentler methods like baking, roasting, or slow cooking. These methods cook the meat more evenly and reduce the risk of burning.

When you trim visible fat and remove skin from poultry when present, you’re further reducing the amount of saturated fat you consume.

Another great tip is to pair your red meat with plenty of vegetables, whole grains, and legumes. This not only balances the meal nutritionally but also helps neutralize any potential negative effects through the antioxidants and fiber found in plant-based foods. Think of meals that include a lean steak with a side of roasted vegetables, quinoa, or a green salad with olive oil and vinegar dressing.

Lastly, don’t forget hydration and mindful eating. Drinking plenty of water and eating slowly can help with digestion and allow you to better appreciate the flavors and textures of your meal.
